basics.name: Markus Berglund
basics.summary: Markus is a technical consultant with experience within a broad range of technologies and businesses. Markus is a certified (PMP) project manager, having lead research projects for next generation mobile networks, as well as product development within internet safety and security.  Markus has excellent communications skills, and often takes a leading role in teams. Comfortable in working on many platforms, in agile teams, and in international organizations. Very well structured and organized.

work.summary: Technical project manager for a team of researchers researching technologies for the next generation mobile systems, focusing on Massive MIMO antenna systems. Project included 25 highly skilled PhD's and MSc's, and resulted in several patent applications.
highlights: 5G Research project with regular contacts with HQ in Shanghai, China

work.summary: Markus was in charge of development for CronLab Ltd’s web filtering services, which was used by companies and schools troughout Europé. The system was also built into other manufacturers’ products, e.g., the Android tablet Kurio, targeted to children, where CronLab’s filtering services limits web access.
highlights: The filtering service has over 1,000,000 users worldwide

work.summary: Markus was in charge of developing an Anti-Spam service which was sold in about 15 countries in Europe. The service had an advanced configuration and management interface, both for end users and for resellers and distributors.
Markus worked with signal processing in the baseband parts of Ericsson’s 3G base station software. The work involved implementing the baseband application on a new architecture based on C++.
highlights: Designed and implemented one of the key memory allocators for the baseband chips
Managed the integration of the different software modules

work.summary: Markus worked with debugging and corrections of live base stations for Ericsson’s customers. The work included testing, simulations, developing new test cases and test methods. The work required a lot of creative debugging since information in trouble reports from customers usually were insufficient.
Developed new functionality in Precise Biometrics JAVA-card smart cards.

The Swedish Rally organization wanted to create arenas along the rally course in Sweden. One of these arenas was Colin’s Crest in Värmland. Markus together with a few more engineers created a system to measure speed and jump length for the cars, this was accomplished with the use of photocells and an FPGA.
Developed software for an FPGA which enabled reading of biological RFID tags which were affected by temperature load. These tags were then used within logistics in the food industry.

Markus developed a communications system for implants based on ultra sound. The work included hardware and software, and realistic experiments. A communications protocol was developed with error correction and high security.

Genovis among other things manufactures microscopic ferro particles which are used in biotech research to e.g. change genetic information in cells. Markus helped Genovis to develop different tools to measure the particles sizes. Both by developing RF electronics to create high frequency magnetic fields and measure the induced energy, but also by developing simple systems to automate some lab tasks made by their staff.

education.summary: Markus graduated first in his class, 6 months ahead of time
C++ specifics for embedded systems with very limited resources

references.name: Michael Wallenius
references.reference: Markus is an extremely sharp and intelligent person with a broad competence ranging from technology to starting a business. On the social side he shares his elegant humor to all around him when there is time for fun. As an entrepreneurial CTO he has been one of the best I've ever met.
